Package edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.manager

Class ServiceWolfManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.service_wolf.model.manager.ServiceWolfManager
  • public class ServiceWolfManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for Managing the ServiceGroups and their Incidents. Implements Singleton design pattern, so there will only be one instance of this class that will interact with ServiceWolfGUI. Class contains methods to interact with ServiceGroups and their Incidents
    Author:
    anthonypulsone

      • getInstance

        public static ServiceWolfManager getInstance()
        Static method to return the singleton instance of ServiceWolfManager
        Returns:
        ServiceWolfManager object

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the current ServiceWolf data to a file by utilizing the methods in the ServiceGroupsWriter class.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the fileName the user is writing the ServiceWolf data to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - passed from the output method if thrown

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads ServiceWolf data from a file utilizing the ServiceGroupsReader class methods. Adds the loaded service groups to current groups
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file that the user is wanting to load

      • getIncidentsAsArray

        public java.lang.String[][] getIncidentsAsArray()
        Creates and returns a 2d Array representation the Incidents in a ServiceGroup to be utilized by the GUI
        Returns:
        2d Array of Incidents

      • getIncidentById

        public Incident getIncidentById​(int id)
        Get an Incident object in the ServiceGroup list from a provided id. returns the Incident in the list with the given id. If there is no Incident with that id, the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Incident that is being searched for
        Returns:
        the Incident if found or null if not

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand​(int id,
                           Command c)
        Finds the Incident with the given id and update it by passing in the given Command.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Incident you are passing a the command to
        c - the command you are passing to the Incident

      • deleteIncidentById

        public void deleteIncidentById​(int id)
        Delete an Incident in the ServiceGroup list from a provided id
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Incident you are deleting

      • addIncidentToServiceGroup

        public void addIncidentToServiceGroup​(java.lang.String title,
                                      java.lang.String caller,
                                      java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a new Incident and adds it to the current ServiceGroup
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the Incident
        caller - the caller of the Incident
        message - the Incident message with details
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if thrown and passed when constructing or adding incident

      • loadServiceGroup

        public void loadServiceGroup​(java.lang.String serviceGroupName)
        Find the ServiceGroup with the given name in the list, make it the active or currentServiceGroup, and set the incident counter for that service group so that any new Incidents added to the service group are created with the next correct id.
        Parameters:
        serviceGroupName - the name of the ServiceGroup the user is attempting to load
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if service group not found

      • getServiceGroupName

        public java.lang.String getServiceGroupName()
        Getter to return the service group name for the currentServiceGroup. If the currentServiceGroup is null, then null is returned.
        Returns:
        name of ServiceGroup or null

      • getServiceGroupList

        public java.lang.String[] getServiceGroupList()
        Getter to return a String array of service group names in the order they are listed in the serviceGroups list. This is used by the GUI to populate the service group drop down
        Returns:
        a String[] containing the names of ServiceGroups

      • clearServiceGroups

        public void clearServiceGroups()
        Resets serviceGroup to an empty array list. The currentServiceGroup is set to null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if called when currentServiceGroup is null

      • editServiceGroup

        public void editServiceGroup​(java.lang.String updateName)
        Updates the currentServiceGroup’s name to the given value. As part of this, there are checks that the updateName is not a duplicate with an existing service group or null or the empty string. The service group is moved to the appropriate location in the serviceGroup list. This should be done by removing it and re adding it to the appropriate location. The serviceGroup is then loaded as the currentServiceGroup by calling the loadServiceGroup(String serviceGroupName) method.
        Parameters:
        updateName - the name that the ServiceGroup is being changed to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if currentServiceGroup is null

      • addServiceGroup

        public void addServiceGroup​(java.lang.String serviceGroupName)
        Creates a new ServiceGroup with the given name and adds it to the serviceGroup list in sorted order by name. The serviceGroup is then loaded as the currentServiceGroup by calling the loadServiceGroup(String serviceGroupName) method. If there is already a service group with the same name (utilizes checkDuplicateServiceName) or if the name is null or an empty string, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the message “Invalid service group name.” Case should be ignored in comparisons for the same name.
        Parameters:
        serviceGroupName - the name of the ServiceGroup you are adding (String)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null, empty, or a duplicate name

      • deleteServiceGroup

        public void deleteServiceGroup()
        This method deletes the currentServiceGroup. The currentServiceGroup is updated to the service group at index 0 or null if there are no service groups left. If the currentServiceGroup is null when attempting to delete, throw an IAE with the message “No service group selected.”
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no service group is selected when attempting to delete a ServiceGroup
